speaker: MULDER
line: I have lived with a fragile faith built on the ether of vague memories from an experience that I can neither prove nor explain.When I was twelve, my sister was taken from me, taken from our home by a force that I came to believe was extraterrestrial. This belief sustained me, fueling a quest for truths that were as elusive as the memory itself. To believe as passionately as I did was not without sacrifice, but I always accepted the risks... to my career, my reputation, my relationships... to life itself...

speaker: MAN
line: Let's move out!

speaker: NURSE
line: We need a frostbite bay, stat!

speaker: DOCTOR
line: All right, let's get ready, please! Basal temp's eighty-six degrees.

speaker: NURSE
line: Right eye dilated. Left eye dilated.

speaker: DOCTOR
line: All right, people, let's get him into that tub or we're going to lose him. On three... one, two, three...

speaker: SECURITY GUARD #1
line: Hold it...

speaker: SCULLY
line: An Agent Mulder was brought here tonight?

speaker: SECURITY GUARD #1
line: This is an authorized area, military personnel only.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm a federal agent!

speaker: SECURITY GUARD #2
line: Ma'am!

speaker: SECURITY GUARD #1
line: Hold on, you're not going anywhere until we can see some I.D.

speaker: SCULLY
line: There's no time for this. A man is dying.

speaker: MULDER
line: What happened to me out on the ice has justified every belief. If I should die now, it would be with the certainty that my faith has been righteous. And if, through death, larger mysteries are revealed, I will have already learned the answer to the question that has driven me here... that there is intelligent life in the universe other than our own... that they are here among us... and that they have begun to colonize.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm Dana Scully, I'm Agent Mulder's partner. What are his vitals?

speaker: DOCTOR
line: He's suffering from extreme hypothermia.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No... you've got to get him out of the tub.

speaker: DOCTOR
line: He's dying, he's lost all his body heat.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You've got to listen to me! If you keep him in there, you're going to kill him! The cold is the only thing that's keeping him alive.

speaker: NURSE
line: His heart stopped!

speaker: DOCTOR
line: Give me one amp of epinephrine in a cannula!

speaker: OFFICER
line: You got to see this captain, we got a UFO or something buzzing us. Right up here. It's been just hovering up there for about twenty minutes.

speaker: CAPTAIN
line: Could be a helicopter.

speaker: OFFICER
line: Not the way it flew over us.

speaker: MAN
line: It's coming at us again.

speaker: OFFICER
line: It's going to crash...

speaker: CAPTAIN
line: Reverse engines!

speaker: DECKHAND
line: Reverse!

speaker: CAPTAIN
line: We're going after it.

speaker: WOMAN
line: Thank you very much.

speaker: NURSE
line: You're welcome.

speaker: ANCHORMAN
line: ...has been covering this story and files this report.

speaker: REPORTER
line: Two days ago, the crew of an ice cutter working the arctic circle thought they had seen a UFO when a strange aircraft plunged into the Beaufort Sea. But a short time later, they recovered what is now believed to be a Russian fighter pilot from the icy water where he miraculously survived the extreme arctic temperatures. The man was airlifted to a military hospital in Alaska where he was listed in stable condition. But while authorities have been trying to determine just who the pilot is, we've learned that he's apparently walked out of the hospital......and is now listed as missing. Reporting from our field...

speaker: ALIEN BOUNTY HUNTER
line: Where is he?

speaker: LANDON PRINCE
line: I don't know!

speaker: MULDER
line: I have been looking for you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I was just down the street. Someone fired more shots at the White House last night.

speaker: MULDER
line: You got to wonder about a country where even the President has to worry about drive-by shootings.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What are you working on?

speaker: MULDER
line: I found these in my e-mail this morning... three obituaries.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Sent by whom?

speaker: MULDER
line: Nobody I know but obviously somebody who knows me.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Why?

speaker: MULDER
line: The deceased are Doctor Landon Prince of Scranton, Pennsylvania... Doctor Dale Gayhart of New York City......and Doctor Harvey Buchanon of Tea Neck, New Jersey. All worked in abortion clinics. They died in separate arson fires.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Sounds like the work of militant right-to-lifers.

speaker: MULDER
line: Sounds like it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Why would somebody send them to you?

speaker: MULDER
line: It's taken me all morning to figure that out.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What did you find?

speaker: MULDER
line: This is the latest victim, Doctor Landon Prince. And these are the other two victims... Doctors Gayhart......and Buchanon.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Triplets?

speaker: MULDER
line: Nope. I can't find any blood connection between them. In fact, I can't find any records on them at all. It's as if before they died, they never existed.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What?

speaker: FEDERAL MARSHALL
line: Doctor Prince performs legal, clinical abortions which seems to be having its own share of occupational hazards these days.

speaker: MULDER
line: You don't know anything else about him?

speaker: FEDERAL MARSHALL
line: Nah, he went about his work quietly. None of his family's come forward.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What about the man you arrested, this, uh, preacher?

speaker: FEDERAL MARSHALL
line: Reverend Calvin Sistrunk. He's got a motive, he's threatened these abortion docs before. He was carrying this when we arrested him. We're hoping for an indictment.

speaker: MULDER
line: As soon as you locate Doctor Prince's remains.

speaker: FEDERAL MARSHALL
line: Yes... but that fact hasn't been released.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, there have been two identical fire deaths. Neither body has been found.

speaker: FEDERAL MARSHALL
line: We're quite certain he was in the building. His car was in the parking lot. We found his keys in the stairwell where the fire was started. He's been missing since the incident. Could be we'll just be finding teeth and bone.

speaker: CALVIN SISTRUNK
line: Good afternoon.

speaker: FEDERAL MARSHALL
line: Reverend Sistrunk... these are Agents Scully and Mulder. They want to ask you...

speaker: CALVIN SISTRUNK
line: ...if Doctor Prince burns in hell's fire for his murder of the unborn? If his damnation is God's will?

speaker: MULDER
line: Is that what you think, Reverend?

speaker: CALVIN SISTRUNK
line: I guess it's a question of opinion.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, it's my opinion that whoever killed Doctor Prince will also be linked to two other murders. How do you feel about that?

speaker: CALVIN SISTRUNK
line: There are those who endorse the killing of the heathen sinner in God's name, but I, sir, am not one of them.

speaker: MULDER
line: Have you been to New York or New Jersey in the past two weeks?

speaker: CALVIN SISTRUNK
line: No, sir.

speaker: MULDER
line: This clipping, where'd you get it?

speaker: CALVIN SISTRUNK
line: From the newspaper. Obviously, there are more of God's soldiers seeking this man for judgement.

speaker: MULDER
line: Which newspaper?

speaker: CALVIN SISTRUNK
line: The local paper, up in Binghamton.

speaker: WOMAN
line: Oh, yeah. I remember this one. The man who placed this payed cash.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Would you recognize his face?

speaker: WOMAN
line: I might. No. That's not him.

speaker: MULDER
line: Do you have a record of his name or address?

speaker: WOMAN
line: No, we don't. He wouldn't sign anything. In fact, he called and asked to place that ad a second week, so we did but he never came back to pay.

speaker: MULDER
line: Thank you.

speaker: WOMAN
line: Sure.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I've got a bad feeling about this case, Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: What do you mean?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, nothing about it makes sense. We've got three deaths of identical victims, no bodies, a virtual non-suspect...

speaker: MULDER
line: Sounds just like an X-File.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You don't even know who sent you that information. I mean, we've been set up before.

speaker: MULDER
line: If somebody really wanted to set us up, would they give us this little to go on? There's something bigger here, Scully. I'd be willing to bet there are more of these guys out there.

speaker: SCULLY
line: More victims?

speaker: MULDER
line: Unless we get to them first. The deaths follow a pattern... New Jersey, New York, Scranton......and then an ad is placed here in Binghamton looking for a man exactly like the others. The killer's moving in a northernly direction. Uh, eh, uh... excuse me? Excuse me. The, uh, number in the ad, is th... would that be a voice mail?

speaker: WOMAN
line: Yes, it is.

speaker: MULDER
line: How, how would you access that?

speaker: WOMAN
line: Well, you'd start by paying the bill. Dial the number, then press twelve-thirty six.

speaker: SCULLY
line: There's twenty four messages responding to the ad. The first caller has seen the man in the photo in Syracuse.

speaker: MULDER
line: That's north.

speaker: BARRETT WEISS
line: Special Agent Weiss.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, this is Agent Mulder. I need to enlist your help.

speaker: BARRETT WEISS
line: Shoot.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm heading your way with Agent Scully. We have reason to believe a man in your area may be in danger. His name is Doctor Aaron Baker, he's living somewhere in Syracuse. We need you to find him and sit on him......until we get there.

speaker: BARRETT WEISS
line: You got it. I'll call you back with an address as soon as I track him down.

speaker: AARON BAKER
line: There were years, years when our people did get along, where we could share in the entire planet. But you seem to be...you seem to be unwilling to share. I don't understand, I don't understand! You did not fail...

speaker: ALIEN BOUNTY HUNTER
line: Your plans will not succeed.

speaker: BARRETT WEISS
line: Federal agent, drop your weapon! I said drop it! What the hell... Agent Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yes, Agent Weiss?

speaker: BARRETT WEISS
line: Yes, sir.

speaker: MULDER
line: Did you find Doctor Baker?

speaker: BARRETT WEISS
line: No, I'm afraid not. No one's home. There's two weeks worth of mail in the mailbox.

speaker: MULDER
line: Uh, we may already be too late but we should take a look around anyway.

speaker: BARRETT WEISS
line: Not much to see.

speaker: SECRETARY
line: Agent Mulder has arrived.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Send him right in. Agent Mulder, please have a seat.

speaker: MULDER
line: Sorry I'm late, I just flew in.

speaker: SKINNER
line: From?

speaker: MULDER
line: Syracuse.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Where you were doing what?

speaker: MULDER
line: Agent Scully and I were following up a lead on a case.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Did anyone authorize this investigation, Agent Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: No, sir.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Do you have paperwork on this case?

speaker: MULDER
line: No, sir. I'd assumed we had an understanding with respect to the X-Files.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I'm sure it doesn't surprise you, Agent Mulder, that the people I have to answer to aren't quite so understanding. Particularly when one of their field agents is found dead.

speaker: MULDER
line: What?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Special Agent Barrett Weiss. Out of the Syracuse office. His body was found stuffed in the trunk of a car in front of a house that you sent him to.

speaker: MULDER
line: It's impossible... I spoke to Agent Weiss, I saw him at the house.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Save it, Agent Mulder, save it for your report because until this matter is cleared up, your butt and mine are in a sling and your investigation, official or otherwise, is terminated.

speaker: MULDER
line: Sir...

speaker: SKINNER
line: Don't underestimate the seriousness of this matter, Agent Mulder. A man is dead. I want a full accounting on my desk in the morning.

speaker: MULDER
line: Mulder.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, it's me.

speaker: MULDER
line: Where are you?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm at home.

speaker: MULDER
line: Agent Weiss is dead, Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What?

speaker: MULDER
line: Somebody killed him and Skinner hit the roof. We're being grounded until he gets a full accounting. I just wish I knew what the hell was going on.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Have you checked your e-mail this morning, Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: No, why?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Because I received something unsettling and I wondered if you'd gotten it too.

speaker: MULDER
line: What is it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's a digitally scanned photograph. There's another one, Mulder. His name is Doctor James Dickens. And Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah?

speaker: SCULLY
line: He's right here in Washington. "Mail 485723

speaker: DATE
line: -- Image enclosed

speaker: FROM
line: 82974@anon.server.ca Dr. James Dickens, Washington D.C." Cut to Mulder.)

speaker: MULDER
line: Stay where you are, Scully, I'll be right there to pick you up.

speaker: AMBROSE CHAPEL
line: Agent Mulder? My name is Ambrose Chapel. I work with the Central Intelligence Agency. I need to talk to you about the case you're working on.

speaker: MULDER
line: What case is that?

speaker: AMBROSE CHAPEL
line: The murder of certain identical victims. I have a story to tell, Agent Mulder. Believe me, you want to hear it. We've known of their existence for a decade. We had no idea they were in the country until last year.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Who are they?

speaker: AMBROSE CHAPEL
line: We're working on vague intelligence reports but it appears early in the Cold War, Soviet scientists stumbled onto genetic anomaly in sets of identical twins. They were able to isolate the specific DNA material that gave the twins their facial features, hair color, texture... and they were able to reproduce it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Are you saying these men are clones?

speaker: AMBROSE CHAPEL
line: By all outward appearances.

speaker: MULDER
line: How did they get here?

speaker: AMBROSE CHAPEL
line: The program went by the codename "Gregor"... the name given to every clone. We believe the original Gregor came here sometime in the mid-70's on a German passport. Using that same document, they were able to bring a small cadre of clones into the country. Several of which have obtained strategic positions in the medical establishment.

speaker: MULDER
line: For what purpose?

speaker: AMBROSE CHAPEL
line: In the event of war, they would mobilize simultaneously at different facilities across the U.S. to contaminate blood supplies, sabotage pharmaceutical factories... essentially destroy the country's immune system.

speaker: SCULLY
line: If you've known about this for a year, why hasn't anything been done?

speaker: AMBROSE CHAPEL
line: Well, this is where the story gets perhaps even more incredible. In a secret agreement, someone is allowing the Gregors to be systematically eliminated by a man who I believe is a Russian spy killer in exchange for the absolute suppression of the program's existence and to obtain the science that created it.

speaker: MULDER
line: What's your business in this?

speaker: AMBROSE CHAPEL
line: I believe we share similar sentiments on our government's policies of denial which is why they've been trying to contact you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Who?

speaker: AMBROSE CHAPEL
line: The Gregors. You've obviously got a reputation as someone who might protect them and bring these misdeeds to light.

speaker: MULDER
line: What makes you think we've been contacted?

speaker: AMBROSE CHAPEL
line: Your inquiries into their deaths... And your response to the ad I placed. We're talking state-sanctioned murder. If we can find them first, maybe the truth can be known.

speaker: MULDER
line: We know where one of these man may be.

speaker: JAMES DICKENS
line: Okay, let's go.

speaker: JAMES DICKENS
line: Who is it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Agents Scully and Mulder, we're with the F.B.I.

speaker: MULDER
line: Doctor Dickens?

speaker: JAMES DICKENS
line: Yes?

speaker: MULDER
line: I believe you've been trying to contact us.

speaker: JAMES DICKENS
line: Uh...

speaker: SCULLY
line: May we come in, Doctor Dickens?

speaker: JAMES DICKENS
line: Um...

speaker: MULDER
line: It's okay, sir, there's nothing to be afraid of!

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'll call the paramedics...

speaker: MULDER
line: He's moving... he's getting up!

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'll call you back. You okay?

speaker: MULDER
line: Okay. I just got the wind knocked out of me. Don't lose him! Go!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Okay...

speaker: MAN
line: Are you all right?

speaker: AMBROSE CHAPEL
line: He's gone.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where?

speaker: AMBROSE CHAPEL
line: He blindsided me. Went up the fire escape before I could grab him. I'm going to go see if I can find a way up on the roof.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How are you feeling?

speaker: MULDER
line: Like I should've used the crosswalk. A lot better than my phone.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Maybe we should've dropped this case when you were told.

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully, if what our friend from the C.I.A. says is true, this could blow the lid off one of the biggest national security conspiracies ever.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Our friend from the C.I.A. is about as unbelievable as his story... as is everything about this case. I mean, whatever happened to "trust no one," Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: Oh, I changed it to "trust everyone." I didn't tell you? I ran a full background check on this guy. Ambrose Chapel is a seventeen-year veteran, special intelligence clearance. He's the real thing, Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Why would a man with his experience need our help... and how could he let a man that he's been looking so hard for slip away so easily? You know, that doctor wasn't running away from us, Mulder, he was running away from Agent Chapel.

speaker: MULDER
line: I think you're being overly paranoid about him, Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Paranoid. Have you stopped to consider that maybe it was Agent Chapel who killed that field agent in Syracuse?

speaker: MULDER
line: Is that what you want me to put on my report to Skinner? Because I would be more than happy to have you explain that to him.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Damn it, Mulder, that is not my job. You'll pursue a case at the expense of everything, to the point of insanity, and expect me to follow you. There has to be somewhere to draw the line.

speaker: MULDER
line: Three identical men are dead. A fourth identical man is alive and on the lam. If the pursuit of this case seems like insanity to you, feel free to step away from it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: An F.B.I. agent died because of our pursuit of this case.

speaker: MULDER
line: Those are the risks we take. You either accept them or you don't. We all draw our own lines.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I have to show you something. I got these a week ago. I stepped in something last night that ate clean through the sole. Now, maybe I'm being paranoid, but it was in the exact spot where this man Chapel said the doctor escaped.

speaker: MULDER
line: Why don't you send it to our lab guys for analysis? And while you're at it, why don't you arrange for an autopsy bay?

speaker: SCULLY
line: An autopsy bay?

speaker: MULDER
line: In putting together my report for Skinner, I came across something I think you'll appreciate. Whoever killed that field agent in Syracuse was so clever, no clear cause of death can be established.

speaker: SCULLY
line: There's no penetrating knife or gunshot wounds. No ligature marks or abrasions from strangulation. The toxicologocial is clean... and the blood work... well, the blood work is strange.

speaker: MULDER
line: Strange how?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, there's evidence of polycythemia, excessive production of red blood cells.

speaker: MULDER
line: How excessive?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Extremely. The doctor who made this report has it in here that the blood was curdled like jelly. As if something caused the blood to thicken or clot prior to death.

speaker: MULDER
line: Due to what?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Possibly a coagulating agent introduced into the body, but it would've shown up on the toxicological.

speaker: MULDER
line: Didn't Agent Chapel say something about these doctors being able to contaminate the blood supply? Couldn't one of those contaminants have been used to kill this man?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't know, Mulder, I... there was a doctor's bag I took as evidence from the apartment.

speaker: MAN
line: Agent Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah?

speaker: MAN
line: Assistant Director Skinner's been looking for you.

speaker: MULDER
line: All right, I'll be right there. Check the bag. See if you can find anything that'll connect.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, Skinner's going to want to know why you didn't file your report. What're you going to say?

speaker: MULDER
line: Just the truth. I got hit by a car.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm sorry this is so late. I had trouble with the, uh, data from the, uh, autopsy...

speaker: SKINNER
line: That's not why I called you in here, Agent Mulder. Uh... your father's been trying to reach you. There's been a family emergency.

speaker: MULDER
line: Thank you.

speaker: MRS. MULDER
line: Hello?

speaker: MULDER
line: Mom?

speaker: MRS. MULDER
line: Fox. Is that you?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, I, I didn't expect you to answer. Wha, what are you doing at Dad's? Is he all right?

speaker: MRS. MULDER
line: Yes. Let me put him on.

speaker: WILLIAM MULDER
line: Hello?

speaker: MULDER
line: Dad? I got a message there was a family emergency.

speaker: WILLIAM MULDER
line: Yes, I received a very strange phone call this afternoon. I called your mother. We think it's important that you come up here as soon as possible.

speaker: MULDER
line: Can you tell me what this is about?

speaker: WILLIAM MULDER
line: I'll know more when you get here.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I didn't find anything much to go on but we've got an address.

speaker: MULDER
line: Check it out, I'll call you as soon as I can.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where you going?

speaker: MULDER
line: Home.

speaker: "NAME
line: Dr. James Dickens

speaker: ADDRESS
line: 3243 Edmonton Street.

speaker: CITY
line: Germantown.")

speaker: MULDER ON MACHINE
line: Hello, this is Fox Mulder. Leave me a message and I'll get back to you as soon as I can.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, it's me. I need to talk to you immediately. I've got some new information on this case. Mulder, I think I'm in danger. I'm in my apartment and I think I've been followed.

speaker: WILLIAM MULDER
line: Your mother needs some time.

speaker: MULDER
line: You said it was an emergency.

speaker: WILLIAM MULDER
line: She wanted you to come. It's a difficult time. I appreciate your coming on such short notice.

speaker: MULDER
line: What is it, Dad?

speaker: WILLIAM MULDER
line: The certainty... becomes a comfort that allows you to move on. We bury our memories so deep after all that has been destroyed... never expecting...

speaker: MULDER
line: Who is Mom talking to?

speaker: WILLIAM MULDER
line: Your sister.

speaker: SAMANTHA MULDER
line: Fox.

speaker: MRS. MULDER
line: After all those sleepless nights, now I can hardly keep my eyes open.

speaker: MULDER
line: You're exhausted. We all are. It's after 5:30.

speaker: MRS. MULDER
line: Oh, I just need a couple of hours.

speaker: MULDER
line: Try and get some sleep.

speaker: MRS. MULDER
line: Fox...

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, Mom?

speaker: MRS. MULDER
line: It is really her... Isn't it?

speaker: MULDER
line: I... I don't see who else it could be. Now go to sleep.

speaker: SAMANTHA MULDER
line: Is it too late for a game of Stratego?

speaker: MULDER
line: It's twenty-two years too late.

speaker: SAMANTHA MULDER
line: I don't think Dad can think of anything to say. He just... sat here.

speaker: MULDER
line: So much has happened. Where do you begin?

speaker: SAMANTHA MULDER
line: I must have been nine or ten when I was returned. I had no memory. I was placed with a family who raised me as a daughter.

speaker: MULDER
line: Who were they?

speaker: SAMANTHA MULDER
line: I knew they weren't my parents but I didn't remember Mom or Dad..or you.

speaker: MULDER
line: But you came to remember... us.

speaker: SAMANTHA MULDER
line: I started having trouble several years ago. It was diagnosed as free-floating anxiety. Nothing worked for me. I hit rock bottom... until I underwent regression hypno-therapy. And it all started coming back... The abductions, the tests... I'm in danger, Fox.

speaker: MULDER
line: What do you mean?

speaker: SAMANTHA MULDER
line: You've been contacted. You know there's a man hunting my father and the other doctors.

speaker: MULDER
line: Your f... your father.

speaker: SAMANTHA MULDER
line: My adoptive parents. They're only visitors here... what people would call "aliens." A bounty hunter's been sent to kill them. You've met this man. His lies to you have caused others like my father to die. He won't stop until he's killed them all and anyone who tries to stop him. He'll come for me soon.

speaker: SCULLY ON MACHINE
line: Hi, this is Dana Scully.

speaker: SCULLY ON MACHINE
line: Please, leave a message and I'll get back to you as soon as I can.

speaker: MULDER
line: Hey, Scully, it's Mulder, pick up the phone. Okay, if you're screening, pick up the phone, I need to talk to you. All right, do not under any circumstances trust the C.I.A. agent. Your life may be in danger, now call me.

speaker: SAMANTHA MULDER
line: She may not be able to recognize him. He has the ability to disguise himself.

speaker: MULDER
line: Disguise himself how?

speaker: SAMANTHA MULDER
line: As anyone.

speaker: MULDER
line: As anyone? You got to be kidding.

speaker: SAMANTHA MULDER
line: No. You can't recognize him, but I can.

speaker: MULDER ON MACHINE
line: Hello, this is Fox Mulder. Leave a message, please.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, it's me. I just left my aparment and I don't think I've been followed. I'm going to be staying at the Vacation Village Motor Lodge off the I-90 in Germantown. Now, by the time you reach me, I should have some very important information for you regarding this case.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Wait. Stop! Federal Agent! Put your hands against the wall. Do it!

speaker: GREGOR CLONE #1
line: You won't shoot me.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Put you hands against the wall... now.

speaker: GREGOR CLONE #1
line: You cannot harm us.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Sir...

speaker: GREGOR CLONE #1
line: It's all right. We are the last remaining. Unless you protect us, we are already dead.

speaker: SCULLY
line: These men are to be held in maximum security protective custody. No visitors, no press, no anybody... okay?

speaker: FBI AGENT
line: Yeah. Can I ask? Who are these guys?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'll let you know when I figure it out myself.

speaker: SCULLY ON MACHINE
line: ...I should have some very important information for you regarding this case.

speaker: MAN
line: Vacation Village.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, I need to speak to Dana Scully, please.

speaker: MAN
line: Just a moment. I'm sorry, there's no one registered by that name.

speaker: MULDER
line: All right, I need her to call Fox Mulder as soon as she checks in, okay? Fox Mulder.

speaker: MAN
line: Fox Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yes.

speaker: MAN
line: Will do. Now who's this message for?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'd like a single for one night, please.

speaker: MAN
line: Uh... see what I got.

speaker: FEDERAL STOCKADE; TILESTON, VIRGINIA; 7
line: 05 PM

speaker: FBI AGENT
line: Whose post is this?

speaker: GUARD #1
line: Mine, sir, we're on changeover.

speaker: FBI AGENT
line: I'm going to talk to the prisoners. Oh, you want to get me a coffee... sugar and milk, no cream.

speaker: GUARD #1
line: Do you want me to keep an eye open?

speaker: FBI AGENT
line: No, just get me the coffee.

speaker: GUARD #1
line: Yes, sir.

speaker: (THE TIME IS 11
line: 21. Scully is asleep. There is a knock on the door and she wakes up. Turning on the lamp, she gets out of bed.)

speaker: SCULLY
line: Who is it?

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully, it's me. I got your message.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where've you been? Hang on... Scully.

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully, it's me, where are you? Scully? Are you there? Scully?
